bow: heartbroken angry but mostly terrified any other us parents considering move out of the country my oldest goes to kindergarten in the fall no planning on staying right here to fight and vote out these bastards that send thoughts and prayers while drowning in blood money from the nra going to make this place better for my child than it was for me sorry that you re sad and scared that totally understandable but use the power you have and help make change yes ve been having recurring this about this all day hear you just feel like nothing can do will rival the billions of dollars the nra is using to buy everyone it just astounding to me the lack of critical thinking see everywhere millions of americans just parroting back guns do kill people starting to give up on people here my kids are in elementary school work in the school in kindergarten class they had actual school shooting drills last year before started working there the kids just told me about them we are starting construction remodel in the school to completely lock it down no one can even get in the school without being buzzed in it is utterly terrifying to me intend to vote and write to my representatives both at the state and federal levels we need to hold our representatives accountable for their inaction yes we are honestly considering moving to another country my son is in kindergarten currently and so terrified that his school will be next hate that fear that and you know what we do have to live like this it does have to be this way america is the only first world country with school shootings hugs mama we did my husband was offered his dream job in texas and job in canada around the time trump won in 2016 we were months pregnant ultimately we turned down the job in texas and moved from los angeles to canada the main reason was for our unborn daughter we wanted to give her the best opportunity and we knew trump win was signaling dark time plus the added bonus of her automatically being canadian citizen should things get really bad it not perfect country but there have been more school shootings this year in the us than in canada entire existence we were lucky to have been given the opportunity something most do get so if you do stay agree with the other moms fight vote do give up have 1year old and am concerned as well something clearly needs to be done but believe that there are components to shooting gun and person the gun is going to shoot itself so the problem begins with the person am an advocate for the second amendment however do not oppose more strict regulation and more thorough background checks this recent shooting involved someone who has had previous mental health related disturbances and therefore should have never been allowed to buy gun also live in south louisiana and come from family of hunters grew up around guns people need to be educated on gun safety before buying gun maybe enforce education courses to potential first time buyers on gun safety also do not have any family members and some are serious hunters that have deemed it necessary to utilize an ar 15 for hunting purposes due to the popularity of this gun with the mentally unstable would be opposed to limiting it sales key thing to remember is that no laws or gun bans will stop someone with the mindset to kill schools are gun free zones yet these crimes occur if we did have guns they find something else that why think mental health needs to take priority also metal detectors work ina hospital and it sickens me to see these mentally unstable patients being discharged all while knowing they will be back soon the government lacks adequate funding for mental health and that needs to be addressed and lastly while consider myself an advocate for the first amendment please know that see problem here too and recognize that change needs to happen my heart breaks for victoms of gun violence and my prayers are with the families at this difficult time my daughter graduates hs in months good lord ca wait and yes we have considered canada but we are too poor to move have an ar 15 and have no idea how to use it let me explain my husband hunts and wanted one for his bday to kill the hogs that were damaging the property so went to gun store and got him one said was buying one for my husband said had no idea what was buying expressed never shooting gun before told them had no idea how to load or handle safely asked what was on sale bought bunch of boxes of ammo no surprise it only took like an hour to purchase no one questioned me no one wondered who my husband was say this because agree it was waaaay too easy for me to purchase such weapon esp being as clueless as am also had my kid with me find it so scary they sold it to me because trust me was obnoxiously stupid about what was buying my husband has everything and mentioned to someone wanting one and went and bought it but if they sold it to stupid me they will sell to anyone this hunting season my husband didn even use it he uses rifle mostly we do eat what he hunts year round live in texas outside of major city and live in very pro gun town everyone know has deer heads on their walls everyone here hunts and fishes and everyone know has gun or guns all the kids here have access to their parents guns my little one is in second grade im terrified esp when he talks about bullies in his class my son has campus that it would be difficult for an intruder and everyone is buzzed in through one entrance and then must be buzzed in again to get to the actual school and to even drive into the parking lot there is guard shack however don think there is metal detectors think there should absolutely be some kind of reform my family depends on the meat my husband shoots but trust me hunting is lot more expensive than just buying cow deer meat is pricey though so it evens out it am here so this is not articulated the best have daughter she 13 going to high school in few months shitless scared lived right by the inland regional center when the shooting happened my kids went to school around there when it happened they were on lockdown felt helpless because school or the police department didn want to say anything we moved and then tragedy struck again mile down the road where my child goes to school another shooting at an elementary school before all that when sandy hook happened had daughter in 1st grade the same grade as those poor innocent babies again felt helpless know exactly where you are coming from really wish these horrible acts would stop already why target the innocent never understand how someone could be so evil and point weapon at child rambling on but do at times want to leave this country but then see my kids they are very happy here they have everything here all could teach them right now is what to in case something so up were to happened to them and answer their questions about the tragedies of gun violence we have the key to end this to teach better generation it all starts with one person from the us originally moved out of the country my husband and have talked before about sending our daughter with dual citizenship to the us for year abroad he now decided he not comfortable with that at all my mom has asked us if we would be willing to take my brother about to start hs for semester originally from the us as well and my husband and have discussed moving back to the states the school shootings thing is absolutely terrifying but the country we live in is becoming the rape capital of the world so staying here does feel awesome either have freshman in hs and 6th grader who share custody with so am stuck here also expecting baby with my current husband who is from spain we absolutely have plans to move to his country with our small child as soon as my custodial agreement with my older sons expires my oldest will already be out of the house and my tween if he isnt in college hope will come with us if wasnt tied to the custody thing we probably already have moved by now most of those kids were all my son age feel like our party system with the electoral college is antiquated and the dnc messed up the last election and besides that on basic level can not see any way to remedy this the guns are out there impossible to take them all back its real mess our society in the us as opposed to other countries ans cultures breeds isolation and lonliness there are so many facets of this problem ita unbelievable already in another country and glad not there have no plans to return all the money in the world can buy your vote yes money in politics has big influence but at the end of the day the voters hold the ultimate power oh mamas feel you mental health counselor there was an article on the front page today about mental health reforms not really changing anything related to violence such as we are discussing and agree with that in fact ve been talking to my clients all week about it angry men and boys almost never get help period therapy as it stands today is for some cultural reason almost intolerable for men in my 15 yr career with the most sick individuals in my regions have never met with person who wanted to kill people they just do seek help feel like the real solution here is teaching our children emotional intelligence and coping skills anger is not an emotion it reaction way to vent fear sadness shame or other emotions you ca manage feel kind of helpless when say that worry that it may be kind of late for our generation to learn these things as whole some people do and can but how many men do you know that actually go to therapy it usually women but we can teach our kids millennials as shamed as they are for safe spaces etc have caught on and ask for what they need emotionally my practice is full of them and see that as great sign mamas teach your children how to feel teach them to ask for help when they need it teach your boys that anger is ok but its sign of something else then help them figure out what that issue may be so they can solve it we can change the world it just our kids who will do it for us do move be brave speak up vote have healthy relationships show them how let the fear motivate you to do better instead of freeze lt am in another country and it awesome my son is in kindergarten this year and we are stationed in the uk not big gun person but my husband is and both of us agree we would rather fight to stay overseas as long as we can because of how much safer it is do even really enjoy the idea of going home on leave because of all the gun craziness going on my best friend had someone pull gun in damn walmart it insane my son is and terrified for him to go to school was bawling my eyes out watching those poor kids run out of school with their hands up to top it off there was school shooting couple towns over from where live about years ago and used to work with girl who was freaking there way too fucking close to home also live in conservative county and assume there are people with guns here was in 8th grade when columbine happened and still live in the same school district so luckily know that they have excellent security measures that have been in place for the last 20 years and assume they could have only gotten better since then but still they were designed to keep outsiders from coming in not to catch someone who brought gun to school just hope something is done in the next three years kids don deserve the burden of worrying about this and neither do parents and teachers can you elaborate bit on the move to canada we are considering moving there what is the housing and job market like what was the process of moving there what is your day to day life like with kids like ease of grocery stores entertainment parks libraries etc feel free to pm me this if it too much to comment thank you my husband and started to make plans to move overseas during the primaries and especially after trump won not because of trump per se more because of the general sentiment and the faction he essentially represents honestly it felt more like pipe dream but job pretty much fell in my lap that allowed us to move to japan with our two young daughters now we re never moving back it insanely safe here my oldest is enrolled in phenomenal school school that is so far beyond anything we could have imagined where we were in the states our youngest she under will be going there as well my paycheck actually matches our living expenses my job is amazing and much healthier work environment than anything experienced in the states we re able to save money for the first time in years on one income we do have to worry about going bankrupt of one of us gets seriously injured or sick and as female can walk home at night alone and not get accosted cat called or made to feel threatened at all we re still going to vote we re never going to relinquish our citizenship no matter how long we re here we re not however moving back to the states for at least 20 years well that terrifying unfortunately many people are being completely bought agree they shouldn be but due to lack of critical thinking and lot of money are potent combination not just in this issue but all kinds of choices that why there so much money in advertising including political advertisements it why lobbyists exist my daughter is 1yo pregnant with oddly enough or not really at all considering how frequently mass shootings happen in the last 10 years or so had just texted my friend on tuesday about being scared to send my kids to school and that was considering homeschooling graduated in 07 after columbine but school shootings were not common yet at all was scared back then but also felt that it was unlikely to happen to me or my school personally 10 years later and now with my own children am terrified and devastated every school shooting hear about can hardly utter the words sandy hook without completely weeping feel like it could happen to any school anywhere and there nothing parents can really do the video footage of the shooting on wednesday particularly shook me could easily place myself in classroom with those students and even worse could easily place my daughter in that classroom it is so much different than when was in school really middle of the road on gun control agree that it is too easy to get gun also far too easy to give gun as gift to someone who may have hidden mental issue from you well live in maine where gun laws are very lax mainers are very pro guns in general and there have never been any school shootings in maine there were two instances somewhat recently within the last years iirc of guns being fired on school grounds both were suicides and both were not in the schools but just on the property perhaps part of that is that many mainers are stringent with gun safety we had our guns locked in safe and always unloaded even before our daughter was born think there more than one facet to this problem guns are too easy to get can agree to that but what is extremely difficult to get is healthcare particularly of the mental health variety ve been there hell still there even with medicaid saw someone post on facebook this week something along the lines of access to guns is constitutional right but access to healthcare is privilege and it rang very true to me as far as can tell nothing at all has changed for the better since mass shootings have become more common and that is possibly more concerning than anything else know was lobbyist at the end of the day the lobbyists have influence the voters have power the only thing lobbyists are really afraid of is voters no but it makes me even more resolved to homeschool my little rugrat with you my oldest company in vancouver un fortunately ca tell you too much what the move was like since the company handled everything travel packing our apartment shipping our car helping us find place paperwork etc they made it really easy they got us here on two year work visa they handled that too and they are now working on getting us permanent residence status it really hard to move live out here without job that brings you here or student visa so if you can get that opportunity go for it the housing market is awful it was literally just ranked as the 3rd worst in the world chinese investors are buying up everything there are ~1000 sq ft homes going for million in the neighborhood live in east van we have no hope of buying home near the city even homes in the surrey langley area over an hour commute are in the high six figures yes its cad not usd but my husband is paid in cad so that our life now which brings me to the job market there are jobs mostly because the middle and lower class ca afford to live here anymore however salary is also one of the lowest in north america my husband took sizable cut in salary despite higher position and then you have to factor in the cad usd conversion that being all said we do really like it here it true that people are so much friendlier here there are parks everywhere in almost every neighborhood we have big one block away the weather this season has
